references.paper_title: Flamingo: a visual language model for few-shot learning
references.reason: This paper introduces Flamingo, a visual language model that is foundational to the current work, demonstrating the state-of-the-art in visual few-shot learning which this paper builds upon.

references.paper_title: Towards monosemanticity: Decomposing language models with dictionary learning
references.reason: This paper explores monosemanticity in language models, a concept relevant to the current research which aims to improve the interpretability and explainability of language models.

references.paper_title: Mllm-as-a-judge: Assessing multimodal llm-as-a-judge with vision-language benchmark
references.reason: This paper introduces a benchmark for evaluating multimodal LLMs, which is directly relevant to the current research that assesses and enhances the performance of similar models.

references.paper_title: African or european swallow? benchmarking large vision-language models for fine-grained object classification
references.reason: This paper focuses on benchmarking large vision-language models for fine-grained object classification, a topic directly related to the current research which seeks to improve performance in this area.

references.paper_title: Domain-specific language model pretraining for biomedical natural language processing
references.reason: This paper demonstrates domain-specific language model pretraining, a method directly relevant to the current work that uses fine-tuning to improve performance in a specific domain.
